note: [Note: Rachel has two friends that are not named, so I referred to them as Friend No. 1 and Friend No. 2.]

content.description: Central Perk, the whole gang is there including Janice.

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: Janice has a question. Who of the six of you has sleep with the six of you?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Wow, it’s like a dirty math problem.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I’m sorry the answer there would be…none of us.

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: Come on over the years none of you ever y’know, got drunk and stupid.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, that’s really a different question.

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: I’m sorry I find it hard to believe that a group of people who spends as much time together as you guys do has never bumped uglies.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, there was that one time that Monica and Rachel got together.

content.speaker: Monica and Rachel
content.text: What?!!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Excuse me, there was no time!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay, but let’s say there was. How might that go?

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: Okay, okay, well then answer me this. Has any of you ever… almost?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Does anybody need more coffee?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, I’ll take some.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, there’s a dog out there!

content.description: Monica and Phoebe’s, three years earlier, Phoebe, Monica, and Ross are there

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, that is so unfortunate.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Cute naked guy is really starting to put on weight.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay, I’ll be back in just a minute. Oh, Phoebe I’m sorry that I left lipstick marks on the phone.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You didn’t leave lipstick marks on the phone.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, then it must’ve been you. Bye. (leaves)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Bye-bye! (to Ross) That’s why I moved out.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey, y’know while we’re on that, when are you gonna tell my sister that you don’t live here anymore.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I think on some levels she already knows.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Phoebe, she doesn’t know that you sneak out every night, she doesn’t know that you sneak back every morning, and she doesn’t know that you’ve been living with your Grandmother’s for a week now.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, well maybe not on those levels.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I’m never gonna find a roommate, ever.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Why, nobody good?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well let’s see, there was the guy with the ferrets, that’s plural. The spitter. Oh-ho, and yes, the guy that enjoyed my name so much he felt the need to make a little noise every time he said it. Nice to meet you, Chandler Bing Bing! Great apartment Chandler Bing, Bing!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: So how many more do you have tomorrow?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Two. This photographer, who seemed really dull. And this actor guy, who I’m not sure about, because when he called and I answered the phone ‘Chandler Bing,’ he said ‘Whoa-whoa, short message.’

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ross (who has his foot on the coffee table), foot on the floor or come over no more!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Sure, your dresser is missing but this she notices.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I have to go. Yeah, Carol should be home by now, soo…

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Umm, how’s it going with you guys?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, better, actually. Y’know I-I-I think I finally figured out why we were having so much trouble lately.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, really?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, y’know how I have you guys, well she doesn’t really have any close friends that are just hers, but last week she meet this woman at the gym, Susan something, and they really hit it off, and I-I-I think it’s gonna make a difference

content.description: Chandler’s, Chandler is interviewing a potential roommate.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Soo, ah, Eric, what kind of photography do ya do?

content.speaker: Eric
content.text: Oh, mostly fashion, so there may be models here from time to time, I hope that’s cool.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yes, that is cool. Because I have models here y’know…never.

content.speaker: Eric
content.text: Oh, yeah, during the summer, I spend most weekends at my sister’s beach house, which you are welcome to use by the way. Although, I should probably tell you, she’s a porn star. (Chandler breaks his pencil in half)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, listen I ah, still have one more person to ah meet, but unless it turns out to be your sister, I think you’re chances are pretty good. (Eric offers to shake hands) All right. (Chandler hugs him.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Bedroom. Bathroom. Living room. This right here is the kitchen, and thanks for coming by, (opens door) Bye-bye.
content.parenthetical: running around the apartment pointing out things

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Don’t you ah, don’t you wanna ask me any questions?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Sure. Ummm. What’s up?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, ah, I’m an actor. I’m fairly neat. I ah, I got my own TV. Oh, and don’t worry I’m totally okay with the gay thing.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What gay thing?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ah, y’know just in general people being gay, thing. I’m totally cool with that.

content.description: the hallway, Monica is coming up the stairs.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well okay Jerry, thanks for stopping by.
(Joey is leaving and notices Monica, as Monica notices him)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hi.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey!
(Joey leaves and Monica mouths to Chandler ‘Oh my God!’)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey, Mon.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey-hey-hey. You wanna hear something that sucks.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Do I ever.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Chris says they’re closing down the bar.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No way!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah, apparently they’re turning it into some kinda coffee place.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Just coffee! Where are we gonna hang out now?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Got me.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Can I get a beer.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey, did you pick a roommate?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You betcha!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Is it the Italian guy?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Um-mm, yeah right!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: He’s so cute.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh yes, and that’s what I want a roommate that I can walk around with and be referred to as the funny one.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh look, the pool table’s free. Rack ‘em up. I’ll be back in just a minute. Get ready for me to whip your butt.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, but after that, we’re shootin’ some pool.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: (to waitress) Oh, um, no, no, no, no excuse me, hello. Hi. My friend ordered an onion, not an olive, and uh I ordered a rum and Diet Coke , which I don’t think this is.
content.parenthetical: sitting at a table with some of her friends

content.speaker: Waitress
content.text: I am so sorry.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: That’s all right. (to her friends) I mean hard is it to get a couple drinks right, huh?

content.speaker: Friend No. 1
content.text: Well, I would like to propose a toast to the woman, who in one year from today, become Mrs. Dr. Barry Farber DDS

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ummm, I think it’s time to see the ring again. (holds her hand out and they all scream)

content.speaker: Friend No. 2
content.text: Oh, isn’t it exciting, I mean it’s like having a boyfriend for life.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, I know.

content.speaker: Friend No. 1
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, I don’t know. Well maybe it’s just the idea of Barry for the rest of my life. I don’t know I think I feel like I need to have one last fling, y’know, just to sorta get it out of my system. (Chandler is listening in very intensely)

content.speaker: Friend No. 1
content.text: Rachel stop!

content.speaker: Friend No. 2
content.text: You’re so bad!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I’m serious, I really, I think I need just to have some…meaningless, sex y’know, with the next guy that I see.
(Chandler throws the cue ball under there table.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Excuse, I seem to have dropped my ball.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, so?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: And now I’ve picked it up again. (walks over to Monica.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh my God, I went to high school with her. (to Rachel) Rachel! Hi!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Monica! Look! Hi! What do ya think? (shows her, her ring)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh my God, you can’t even see where the Titanic hit it.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yes, his name is Barry, he’s a doctor, thank you very much.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Awww, just like you always wanted. Congratulations

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Thank you. So how-how ‘bout you, are-are you seeing anybody?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Aww, not right now.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, but that’s okay.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I know.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah.
(An awkward silence)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: So, I’ll get-get back to my friend.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, yeah, sure, sure, sure, sure. (points at Chandler, who holds up the cue ball as a ‘Remember me?’ thing) Listen, can we please have lunch the next time I’m in the city?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, that’d be great.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Thanks.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Bye!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Bye! (to Chandler) Ten bucks says, I never see that woman again in my life.

content.description: Monica and Phoebe’s, Ross is on the phone, as Phoebe is walking by carrying a lamp.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No real-, honey, really it’s fine, just g-go with Susan. Really, I, no, I think girls night out is a great idea. Okay, okay, bye

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: So what are they doing?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I don’t know, something girlie.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey, you’re early.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What are you doing with the lamp?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I’m just taking it to be re-wired.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, well don’t take it to the same place you took the stereo, ‘cause they’ve had that thing for over a week.
(There is a knock on the door, Phoebe answers it, its Mr. Heckles)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No, no, Mr. Heckles no one is making any noise up here.

content.speaker: Mr. Heckles
content.text: You’re disturbing my oboe practice.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You don’t play the oboe!

content.speaker: Mr. Heckles
content.text: I could play the oboe!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Then I’m gonna have to ask you to keep it down. (slams the door in his face.)
(in the hallway, Eric is moving in)

content.speaker: Mr. Heckles
content.text: Who are you?

content.speaker: Eric
content.text: Hi, I’m Eric, I’m gonna be Chandler’s new roommate.

content.speaker: Mr. Heckles
content.text: I’m Chandler’s new roommate.

content.speaker: Eric
content.text: I-I-I don’t think so.

content.speaker: Mr. Heckles
content.text: I could be Chandler’s new roommate.

content.speaker: Eric
content.text: But, he told me over the phone.

content.speaker: Mr. Heckles
content.text: He told me in person.

content.speaker: Eric
content.text: That’s weird.

content.speaker: Mr. Heckles
content.text: Well, I’m going to go into my new apartment now. (goes over to the door and opens it) Ehh! (Eric leaves)
(inside Chandler’s apartment, Chandler is coming in from his bedroom, sees Mr. Heckles, and screams.)

content.description: the hallway, Joey is moving in, Monica is leaving.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hi, again.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey! (goes into the apartment)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Thank you soo, much.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, don’t thank me, thank the jerk that never showed up. Okay, I gotta get to get to work.
(Joey comes back into the hallway and starts to pick up a heavy box)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You want some help with that?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, no thanks, I got it. (picks it up) No I don’t!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Whoa! Are you okay?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Whew! Stood up to fast, got a little head rush.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: It’s the heat. (has her hand on his chest, and then pulls it away) And-and the humidity.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: That’s a uh, that’s a tough combination.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Do you wanna come in for some lemonade?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Like you wouldn’t believe. (they go into the apartment) Wow! This is a great place.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Thank you. Just make yourself comfortable.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Gotcha.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: This place is really my Grandmother’s. (Joey starts to take off all of his clothes, while Monica gets the glasses and pours the lemonade.) I got it from her when she moved to Florida, otherwise I could never afford a place like this. So if the landlord ever asks, I’m 87 year old woman, who’s afraid of her VCR. So are you thirsty?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, you bet I am!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay, here’s your penis!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh my God!!! What are you doing?!!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You said, you wanna come in for some lemonade?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: So?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Whoa, ah!! We’re you just gonna give me some lemonade?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah huh!! Cover yourself up!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh right, right.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I don’t believe this! When someone asks you in for lemonade, and to you that means they wanna have sex?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well usually…yeah! Well, not just lemonade, iced tea, sometimes juice. Well, sorry, I just, I thought you liked me. I’m such a jerk.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: It’s okay. I suppose it could happen to anyone, not anyone I know, but… By the way I can still see it.

content.description: Monica and Phoebe’s, Monica is vacuuming.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Pheebs?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Huh?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Where’s your bed?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: It’s not in the apartment? (Monica gives a ‘Come on’ look) Oh no. I can’t believe this is happening again.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, enough with the third degree! I-I’ve, I don’t live here anymore.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What are you talking about?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I’m sorry, I-I-I-I don’t live here anymore. I-I didn’t know how to tell you, but y’know everybody else knows!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Everybody knows!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: That was supposed to be a good thing, I forget why. Just listen, Monica, I, do you know, okay, do you know, I couldn’t sleep for like a month because I got like a dot of ink on one of the sofa cushions.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well, you-you coulda just turned the cushion over.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, I would’ve except I had a big spaghetti stain on the other side.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What?!?!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, this is what I’m talking about, this. I-I need to live in a land where people can spill.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You can spill. In the sink.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Aw, honey it’s not your fault, y’know this is who you are, and I love you, and I want us to be friends, and if I keep living here I don’t see that happening.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I love you, too.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Aww, good. (they hug) What?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What? I’m just said.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No you’re not, you’re wondering which cushion it is.

content.description: [Scene: Chandler and Joey’s, (now) Joey is watching Baywatch, as Chandler enters from his bedroom.]

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: So ah, whatcha watching?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Baywatch.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What’s it about?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Lifeguards.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, it sounds kinda stupid… (looks at the TV) Who’s she?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Nicole Eggert. You’ll like her.
(Baywatch goes into one of those running scenes.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Wow! Look at them run.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: They do that a lot. Hey, you want a beer?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, I’ll go get one.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No, no, no, don’t get up, I got a cooler right here.

content.description: Monica’s, Monica is coming out of the bathroom wearing nothing but a towel, as Chandler is entering.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, hello!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Do you have any beers? We’re out of beers.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Help yourself.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You okay?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Phoebe moved out.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Right.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I don’t understand, I mean am I so hard to live, is this why I don’t have a boyfriend?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Noo!! You don’t have a boyfriend because…I don’t, I don’t know why you don’t have a boyfriend. You should have a boyfriend.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well, I think so.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh-ho, come here. (goes and hugs her) Listen, you are one of my favourite people and the most beautiful woman I’ve ever known in real life.

content.description: the bar, Ross is entering, Phoebe is at the bar, they are the only two in the place.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hi. Where is everybody?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, it’s already closed, Chris gave me the keys to lock up-what is wrong?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: My marriage, I think my marriage is um, is kinda over.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh no! Why?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: ‘Cause Carol’s a lesbian. (Phoebe is shocked) And, and I’m not one. And apparently it’s not a mix and match situation.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh my God! I don’t believe it! Oh, you poor bunny.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I’m an idiot. I mean shoulda seen it, I mean Carol and I’d be out and she’d, she’d see some beautiful woman, and, and she’d be Ross y’know look at her, and I’d think, God, my wife is cool!
content.parenthetical: sets out a bunch of shot glasses and starts to poor himself a drink, many drinks

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Aw! Hey, do you think that Susan person is her lover?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, now I do!!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I’m sorry.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Seven years. I mean we’ve been together seven years, she’s the only woman who’s ever loved me, and the only woman I’ve-I’ve ever…

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Aw, God Ross. Oh.(goes over and hugs him)

content.description: Monica’s, Chandler and Monica are still hugging each other.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Umm, this is nice.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I know, it is isn’t it?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No, I mean it, this feels really good. Is it a hundred percent cotton?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah! And I got it on sale, too.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Anyway, I should go, one of the lifeguards was just about to dismantle a nuclear device.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well, if you wanna get a drink later we can.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh yeah, that sounds great. (starts to leave) Oh, and listen, it’s, it’s gonna be…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I know. Thanks. (Chandler leaves)

content.description: the bar, Phoebe is still hugging Ross.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Maybe this would’ve happened if I’d been more nurturing, or I’d paid more attention, or I… had a uterus. I can’t believe this!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I know no, no, y’know you don’t deserve this, you don’t Ross. You’re, you’re really, you’re so good. (kisses him on the cheek)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Thanks.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: And you’re so sweet. (kisses him on the other cheek) And you’re kind (kisses him on the lips)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Thanks. (kisses her on the lips)
(They pause, and they the start kissing passionately, and taking off each others clothes, and they start to lie down on the pool table.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Wait, wait, wait, wait, wait.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Huh?
(Ross tries to clear off the pool table by knocking the balls to the other end of the table, but they all bounce back, and he frantically starts to throw them into the pockets.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, it’s okay.
(Phoebe jumps on to the table and lays down, Ross follows her and hits his head on the light hanging over the pool table.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh. (they start kissing again)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Wait, wait, wait.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: My foot is stuck in the pocket.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No, I can’t get it out.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, that’s not something a girl wants to hear.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No, come on don’t start. (they start kissing again) Ouch!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Stupid balls are in the way. (holds up two balls)
(They both look at each other and start laughing (Lisa almost lost it there), and sit up. Ross hits his head on the lamp again.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh well. It probably would’ve been the most constructive solution.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You have chalk on your face.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Huh? (the rest of the gang enters)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, Ross you’re right, I don’t know why I always thought this was real grass.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey, are you okay?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: My wife’s a lesbian.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Cool!!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ross-Joey, Joey-Ross. (they shake hands)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hi.

content.description: the bar, Chandler is playing pool, as Rachel enters.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I can’t believe you came back.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Don’t say anything. I don’t wanna speak, I don’t wanna think. I just want you to take me and kiss me and make love to me right here, right now.
(She hits the jukebox Fonzy style, and It’s That Time of Season starts to play, as they start to kiss.)

content.speaker: Friend No. 2
content.text: Rachel! Rachel! (stirs Rachel from her dream, she’s in her car driving back from the city)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Friend No. 2
content.text: You missed the exit!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, sorry.

content.speaker: Friend No. 1
content.text: My God, what were you thinking about?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Um, (shyly) Barry.

content.speaker: Her Friends
content.text: Awwww!!
